p: Tropospheric O 3 is harmful to both plants and animals (including humans). O 3 affects plants in several ways. Stomata are the cells, mostly on the underside of the plant leaves, that allow CO 2 and water to diffuse into the tissue. High concentrations of O 3 cause plants to close their stomata ( McAdam et al., 2017), slowing down photosynthesis and plant growth. O 3 may also provoke strong oxidative stress, damaging plant cells ( Vainonen and Kangasj√§rvi, 2015).
